availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Minerva J. Wood in Robertson County, Tennessee, on February 1, 1858. Father of Fannie J. Wood, Sarah A. Wood, and Robert L. Wood. Farmer in Paducah, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, District 2, p. 779.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, p. 423B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Precinct 6, p. 79A.
Tennessee State Marriage Records, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Robertson County Marriages, 1859-1868, p. 2723 of 2731 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
